content:
• Wednesday, September 28, 2011
  • QTRH

    Wi-LAN (WILN) extends its offer to acquire MOSAID Technologies to 5 p.m. EDT on Oct. 14, unless...

    Wi-LAN (WILN) extends its offer to acquire MOSAID Technologies to 5 p.m. EDT on Oct. 14, unless further extended or withdrawn. MOSAID has urged its shareholders to reject the company's "highly opportunistic" offer, calling it a hostile takeover. Shares -5.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:49 PM
  • MOS

    More on Mosaic (NYSE:MOS): FQ1 misses estimates despite a 77% jump in Y/Y profit. Gross margins...

    More on Mosaic (NYSE:MOS): FQ1 misses estimates despite a 77% jump in Y/Y profit. Gross margins widened to 27.5% from 23.1%. Sales of phosphates and potash were each up 40%, helped by higher volumes and selling prices. Shares -1.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:32 PM
  • AMD

    AMD falls 9.4% AH after warning its Q3 revenue will increase only 4-6% Q/Q, compared with prior...

    AMD falls 9.4% AH after warning its Q3 revenue will increase only 4-6% Q/Q, compared with prior guidance of 8-12%. The company also expects its gross margin to come in at 44-45%, below guidance of 47%. AMD primarily blames the weakness on manufacturing issues related to its 32nm technology. Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) ramped 32nm production in early 2010.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM
  • HIG

    Hartford Financial (HIG -5.2%) reportedly halts an effort to sell its mutual fund unit after...

    Hartford Financial (HIG -5.2%) reportedly halts an effort to sell its mutual fund unit after banks cut back on lending for leveraged buyouts, raising red flags that M&A deals are growing more difficult. Henry Kravis (NYSE:KKR) says investors are demanding more than two percentage points in additional yield since April to buy leveraged loans, he says.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM
  • WPM

    Silver miners are having another rough day, as a 5.1% decline in silver futures leaves them once...

    Silver miners are having another rough day, as a 5.1% decline in silver futures leaves them once more trading below $30/oz. SLW -6.9%. CDE -5.7%. SSRI -7.1%. EKX -5.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM | 1 Comment
  • TSN

    Tyson Foods (TSN -3.1%) trades lower after the the company recalls around 131,300 pounds of...

    Tyson Foods (TSN -3.1%) trades lower after the the company recalls around 131,300 pounds of ground beef over worries it may be contaminated with e.coli.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • MED

    Medifast (MED +1.3%) trades higher after Auriga initiates the shares with a buy. Auriga says the...

    Medifast (MED +1.3%) trades higher after Auriga initiates the shares with a buy. Auriga says the company is going to see top line and earnings growth over the next few years, as the expansion of its coaching network as well as higher-end model weight control centers allow the company to further penetrate the commercial weight loss market.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM
  • AEIS

    In the face of a challenging market for solar suppliers, Advanced Energy Industries (AEIS +3.3%)...

    In the face of a challenging market for solar suppliers, Advanced Energy Industries (AEIS +3.3%) announces plans to restructure its manufacturing and R&D operations and cut jobs, primarily in its thin films business unit.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • NTRI

    Nutrisystem (NTRI +3.1%) gains after Auriga initiates coverage with a buy, saying it expects the...

    Nutrisystem (NTRI +3.1%) gains after Auriga initiates coverage with a buy, saying it expects the company to bounce back over the next year as it improves its menu, ramps up a new marketing strategy and expands into new markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM
  • NEOG

    Neogen (NEOG +5%) gains after Craig-Hallum raises it to buy , saying it sees "signs of growth...

    Neogen (NEOG +5%) gains after Craig-Hallum raises it to buy , saying it sees "signs of growth returning in the near future." Stephens also upgrades the stock to overweight on valuation, and Roth Capital reiterates a buy as well.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • KODK

    Fitch Ratings follows up on Moody's downgrade of Eastman Kodak's (EK -12.6%) credit rating with...

    Fitch Ratings follows up on Moody's downgrade of Eastman Kodak's (EK -12.6%) credit rating with its own cut to CC - a level signifying "default of some kind appears probable." It's been a horrendous week for shares - down 38% in three days - kickstarted when the firm drew $160M from a credit line. EK once a Dow 30 stock, now trades for the price of a black coffee from SBUX.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • LQDT

    Liquidity Services (LQDT +13.3%) ramps higher after Stifel Nicolaus initiates the shares with a...

    Liquidity Services (LQDT +13.3%) ramps higher after Stifel Nicolaus initiates the shares with a buy. The firm notes its stable revenue growth of more than 20%, and margin and earnings upside is likely to benefit from growth, both organically and through acquisitions.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • AMRN

    The swoon in shares of Amarin (AMRN -7.3%) may be attributed to an article on the lack of buyers...

    The swoon in shares of Amarin (AMRN -7.3%) may be attributed to an article on the lack of buyers for the company. Once seen as an attractive takeover target with a new heart drug that helps lower triglycerides expected to rake in $1B-plus in annual sales if approved, skeptics now say it could take 12-18 months before investment prospects again become attractive.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • IRBT

    iRobot (NASDAQ:IRBT) announces it received a $60M contract to outfit the Army with robots, but...

    iRobot (NASDAQ:IRBT) announces it received a $60M contract to outfit the Army with robots, but shares fall back 3.8% - indicating a bigger payoff may have been anticipated from the Street.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • HII

    Huntington Ingalls Industries (HII -8.8%) trades lower after Goldman initiates the stock with a...

    Huntington Ingalls Industries (HII -8.8%) trades lower after Goldman initiates the stock with a sell. The firm says the military shipbuilder has the one of the worst balance sheets in its defense coverage, and is likely to see its business shrink as DoD budgets and Navy plans are revised downward.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • JBL

    Goldman and Collins Stewart sing Jabil's (JBL +7.8%) praises following its earnings beat (I,...

    Goldman and Collins Stewart sing Jabil's (JBL +7.8%) praises following its earnings beat (I, II). The former thinks the growth of Jabil's value-added services business will boost margins, while the latter thinks Jabil will continue benefiting from a mostly healthy tech spending environment. Rising in sympathy: FLEX +1.9%, CLS +1.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM
  • GLP

    Fuel distributor Global Partners (GLP -9.3%) gets hit after BofA Merrill Lynch cuts the shares...

    Fuel distributor Global Partners (GLP -9.3%) gets hit after BofA Merrill Lynch cuts the shares to neutral. Merrill cites weak gasoline demand, plus growing uncertainty over its margins given uncertain developments in its refined-products market.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • EMGC

    Shares of Imperial Holdings (IFT -63%) plummet a day after the FBI raided the firm’s Boca...

    Shares of Imperial Holdings (IFT -63%) plummet a day after the FBI raided the firm’s Boca Raton offices. The company says the raid apparently was related to its life insurance settlement business, which buys policies from people for a fraction of their value and then collect in full when the person dies.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • YNDX

    Yandex (YNDX -13.5%) plunges after a meeting with some hedge funds fails to go smoothly, and...

    Yandex (YNDX -13.5%) plunges after a meeting with some hedge funds fails to go smoothly, and raises fears of declining search market share. Yandex has issued a (poorly-worded) statement claiming its CEO may have been misunderstood during the meeting, but admitting the presence of "increased competitive pressure from Google" (NASDAQ:GOOG).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM | 2 Comments
  • PLAB

    JPMorgan initiates coverage on Phototronics (NASDAQ:PLAB) with a Neutral rating and $6.50 price...

    JPMorgan initiates coverage on Phototronics (NASDAQ:PLAB) with a Neutral rating and $6.50 price target, offering  up a mixed review: "Although we believe the company is better positioned than it has been in years, we don't believe it is immune to weakness in its end markets or aggressive pricing by large competitors." Shares are down 9.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • BIOS

    Shares of BioScrip (NASDAQ:BIOS) gain 7% after BB&T initiates with a Buy rating and an...

    Shares of BioScrip (NASDAQ:BIOS) gain 7% after BB&T initiates with a Buy rating and an elevated price target of $10 - repping 61% upside potential for shares of the pharmacy and home health provider.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • RNWEF

    In addition to Cantor's negative comments, Renewable Energy (OTCPK:RNWEF) adds to the pain in...

    In addition to Cantor's negative comments, Renewable Energy (OTCPK:RNWEF) adds to the pain in solar-panel maker stocks after saying it's considering permanently closing parts of its Norwegian production as it struggles to compete with lower-cost competitors and plummeting raw polysilicon prices. First Solar (FSLR -7%), Trina Solar (TSL -5.8%).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM | 5 Comments
  • T

    Shares of DirecTV (DTV +1.4%) get a lift from JPMorgan with an Overweight rating, as the firm...

    Shares of DirecTV (DTV +1.4%) get a lift from JPMorgan with an Overweight rating, as the firm takes a dimmer view of rival Dish Network (DISH -1.5%). Analysts initiate DISH with a Neutral rating, remaining unimpressed with its new Movie Pass promotion seen by the company as a Netflix (NFLX -0.2%)-killer. "We don't believe the service poses a compelling alternative to broadly compete with Netflix at this point."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • DHT

    Oil shipping stocks take a hit after Bank of America Merrill Lynch slashes its 2011 and 2012...

    Oil shipping stocks take a hit after Bank of America Merrill Lynch slashes its 2011 and 2012 spot-rate forecasts due to a weak macro environment. The firm cuts both DHT Holdings (DHT -5.8%) and Teekay Tankers (TNK -8.3%) to underperform (I, II). Other peers trading lower: Alexander & Baldwin (ALEX -2.9%), Seacor (CKH -2.3%), Kirby (KEX -1.6%).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM | 2 Comments
  • KODK

    Eastman Kodak (EK -5.4%) dips after Moody's cut its credit rating late yesterday to Caa2, a...

    Eastman Kodak (EK -5.4%) dips after Moody's cut its credit rating late yesterday to Caa2, a notch deeper into highly speculative territory. The action was taken after the company's surprised investors last week with an unexpectedly large draw on its credit facility due to dwindling cash flows.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • AMZN

    Kindle announcement aftermath: Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) keeps trekking higher, now up 4.8%. Apple...

    Kindle announcement aftermath: Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) keeps trekking higher, now up 4.8%. Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) shows no ill effects, flatlining for most of the day and now poking out a 0.2% gain. Uncontrolled bleeding at Barnes & Noble (NYSE:BKS), shares down 11.2% and still sinking. With the crucial holiday season coming up, can BKS recover with a new launch or inspired pricing cut?

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • ATU

    Actuant (ATU +6.3%) FQ4 earnings beat estimates on strong sales growth and continued improvement...

    Actuant (ATU +6.3%) FQ4 earnings beat estimates on strong sales growth and continued improvement in its energy segment. For the current quarter, the company projects earnings to come in the mid-range of estimates, and reaffirms its FY outlook. Separately, the board approves a 7M share stock buyback.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • CIS

    Camelot Information Systems (CIS -23%) gets hammered after lowering Q3 guidance and and FY11...

    Camelot Information Systems (CIS -23%) gets hammered after lowering Q3 guidance and and FY11 revenue projections due to weakness in its financial industry IT service business lines in Taiwan and China. It now expects Q3 revenue of about $57M, below earlier forecasts for $63M, and FY11 net revenue of about $235M, down from previous estimates of $244M. Separately, William Blair cuts the shares to market perform.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM
  • OMN

    Specialty-chemicals maker Omnova Solutions (OMN +8%) pops as FQ3 earnings easily topped...

    Specialty-chemicals maker Omnova Solutions (OMN +8%) pops as FQ3 earnings easily topped estimates. Profits tanked 89% Y/Y due to lower volume, which was largely expected, but margins were better as the company reduced expenses. Core profit also rose as the market easily absorbed higher prices. The company says it expects to reach the top end of its full-year earnings projection.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • SBUX

    Production of robusta coffee looks set to ramp up right along with arabica beans, as coffee...

    Production of robusta coffee looks set to ramp up right along with arabica beans, as coffee prices could move even lower with stockpiles continuing to recover from last year's shocks. Will Starbucks (SBUX +0.3%) follow the path of SJM and KFT with lower consumer prices or reap margin gains as it restocks inventory?

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • SABA

    Saba Software (OTCPK:SABA +7.5%) FQ1 beat estimates across-the-board on a jump in revenue and...

    Saba Software (OTCPK:SABA +7.5%) FQ1 beat estimates across-the-board on a jump in revenue and better gross margins. Strength was broad-based across geographies and all market segments, as higher subscription and professional services revenue more than offset lower license revenue. The company reafirms targets for FY12.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • IOC

    InterOil (IOC -15.5%) continues to plummet following yesterday's harsh comments from PNG's oil...

    InterOil (IOC -15.5%) continues to plummet following yesterday's harsh comments from PNG's oil minister. Raymond James blames Shell (NYSE:RDS.A) for the shenanigans, saying the company wants a piece of IOC's business. James Emerson calls the news a possible "death knell" for the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • TPX

    Sealy (ZZ -12.3%) FQ3 swings to a profit as the mattress maker reported higher sales in the U.S....

    Sealy (ZZ -12.3%) FQ3 swings to a profit as the mattress maker reported higher sales in the U.S. and abroad, but warns of a slowing economy hurting retailers in the coming months. CEO Larry Rogers said the overall outlook for the consumer environment was "shaky," adding that due to the impact of raw material inflation, the company would be challenged to deliver gross margin expansion and earnings performance in H2.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • DWDP

    Shares of chemical companies turn lower following their European brethren, led by a 4.1% fall in...

    Shares of chemical companies turn lower following their European brethren, led by a 4.1% fall in shares of Dow Chemical (DOW).  Decliners: HUN -2.4%, ROC -3.9%, EMN -3.1%, POL -3.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR -5.8%) falls after Cantor Fitzgerald reiterates a Sell, and lowers its PT to...

    First Solar (FSLR -5.8%) falls after Cantor Fitzgerald reiterates a Sell, and lowers its PT to $55. Cantor sees continued oversupply in the solar market hurting First Solar's sales and pricing power. Nonetheless, the firm thinks First Solar is well-positioned to profit long-term, as the market consolidates, and subsidy reductions increase the value of its cost advantage.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM | 1 Comment
  • SNX

    Synnex (SNX +11.4%) FQ3 earnings rose 26% on better margins and a jump in revenue, as the...

    Synnex (SNX +11.4%) FQ3 earnings rose 26% on better margins and a jump in revenue, as the information-technology distributor said it captured more market share. The company boosts guidance for FQ4, now seeing an EPS of between $1.11 to $1.15 per share on revenue from $2.78B to $2.88B, versus EPS estimates of $1.10 on $2.81B in revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • MKC

    McCormick & Co.'s (MKC -2.75%) FQ3 earnings beat, but profits sank 10% Y/Y on higher raw...

    McCormick & Co.'s (MKC -2.75%) FQ3 earnings beat, but profits sank 10% Y/Y on higher raw material costs and a one-time gain last year that skewed comparisons. The company reafirms FY11 guidance to the low end of estimates. For the year, it expects to to grow sales 6% to 8% and sees an EPS of $2.74 to $2.79 versus estimates of $2.78.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX +2.5%) shares move higher, attributed to comments from Piper Jaffray suggesting...

    Netflix (NFLX +2.5%) shares move higher, attributed to comments from Piper Jaffray suggesting subscriber cancellations are moderating: "While we continue to expect elevated churn over the next few quarters, the risk of a mass exodus appears to be moderating" following its latest survey. Piper sets a $300 price target on the shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM | 7 Comments
  • ADDYY

    Shares of shoe companies look a little skittish after Reebok (OTCQX:ADDYY) settles with the FTC...

    Shares of shoe companies look a little skittish after Reebok (OTCQX:ADDYY) settles with the FTC for $25M over deceptive claims certain brands of its shoes led to muscle toning. Though the settlement amount is small to a multi-billion dollar industry, the sector could now face pressure to back up claims "toning" shoes aren't gimmicks. Decliners: SKX -2.2%, SHOO -2.4%, CROX -3.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy's (CHK +4.4%) production ramp up in Eastern Ohio spills over to lift shares of...

    Chesapeake Energy's (CHK +4.4%) production ramp up in Eastern Ohio spills over to lift shares of other natural gas producers that have a piece of the Utica Shale project. Gainers: GPOR +6.6%, EVEP-OLD +4.8%, REXX +4.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • MODL

    MedQuist (OTCPK:MEDH -6.8%) takes a hit this morning on a Lazard downgrade to neutral from buy,...

    MedQuist (OTCPK:MEDH -6.8%) takes a hit this morning on a Lazard downgrade to neutral from buy, The firm notes significant changes made to the company's strategic plan that have yet to be articulated.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • T

    Leap Wireless (LEAP) gains 8.7% after Bernstein upgrades the discount wireless carrier to...

    Leap Wireless (LEAP) gains 8.7% after Bernstein upgrades the discount wireless carrier to Outperform, and lifts its PT to $12. Short-covering could be playing a role in the rally - as of Sep. 15, 26.9% of Leap's float was shorted.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • DRI

    Shares of Darden Restaurants (DRI -4.6%) fall after the firm's FQ1 report highlights the...

    Shares of Darden Restaurants (DRI -4.6%) fall after the firm's FQ1 report highlights the struggles of the restaurant operator to combat higher commodity prices and ongoing woes at the firm's Olive Garden chain.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • BKS

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (NYSE:BKS) take a punch to the gut, losing 8.3% after Amazon's...

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (NYSE:BKS) take a punch to the gut, losing 8.3% after Amazon's (AMZN +1.1%) Kindle Fire launches. The rumor mill churns out chatter that the company will launch a new e-reader next quarter at a price point of $349...a 75% premium to the new Kindle.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • AMZN

    In addition to the Kindle Fire, Amazon (AMZN +3.1%) will be rolling out a version of its...

    In addition to the Kindle Fire, Amazon (AMZN +3.1%) will be rolling out a version of its traditional Kindle e-reader for a mere $79, according to Bloomberg BusinessWeek. Currently, the cheapest Kindle sells for $114 (ad-supported), and the cheapest Barnes & Noble (BKS -7.3%) Nook sells for $139.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM
  • RLD

    RealD (RLD -10.6%) shares sink after Sony's (NYSE:SNE) movie studio reportedly tells theater...

    RealD (RLD -10.6%) shares sink after Sony's (NYSE:SNE) movie studio reportedly tells theater owners that it will stop paying millions of dollars per film for disposable 3-D glasses starting next May. RLD had jumped 6% yesterday after the company was discussed as a takeover target.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM | 1 Comment
  • AMZN

    Amazon.com (AMZN +3.3%) unveils its much-anticipated tablet. Called the Kindle Fire (as...

    Amazon.com (AMZN +3.3%) unveils its much-anticipated tablet. Called the Kindle Fire (as previously reported), the device will feature a 7-inch display and cost only $199, $50 less than the Nook Color (BKS -6.3%) and $300 less than the cheapest iPad (AAPL +0.5%). The tablet will run on Android (NASDAQ:GOOG), but nonetheless act like a "souped-up Kindle."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM | 2 Comments
  • MSFT

    Microsoft (MSFT +1.9%) spikes higher following its smartphone deal with Samsung (OTC:SSNLF)....

    Microsoft (MSFT +1.9%) spikes higher following its smartphone deal with Samsung (OTC:SSNLF). Nokia (NOK +1.2%) and InterDigital (IDCC +5.6%) could also be gaining on the news - the former due to the deal's bolstering of the Windows Phone ecosystem, the latter due to the way the deal highlights the value of wireless IP. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • BZ

    Shares of Boise (NYSE:BZ) lose 7% after the company gets hits with a downgrade from JPMorgan to...

    Shares of Boise (NYSE:BZ) lose 7% after the company gets hits with a downgrade from JPMorgan to Neutral. The firm's price target of $7 on BZ still represents upside potential for shares of the manufacturing company.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM
  • TNH

    Shares of fertilizer-related companies open lower across the board, led by Terra Nitrogen...

    Shares of fertilizer-related companies open lower across the board, led by Terra Nitrogen (NYSE:TNH) down 2%. Decliners: CF -1.8%, MOS -1.6%, AGU -1.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • AVGO

    Analog chipmaker Avago Technologies (NASDAQ:AVGO) drops 3.7% after the company announces its...

    Analog chipmaker Avago Technologies (NASDAQ:AVGO) drops 3.7% after the company announces its one-time private equity owners will be selling at least 15M shares in a secondary offering.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • BMRN

    Deutsche gives a lift to shares of Biomarin Pharmaceuticals (BMRN +2.7%),upgrading the company...

    Deutsche gives a lift to shares of Biomarin Pharmaceuticals (BMRN +2.7%),upgrading the company to Buy from Hold on the strength of its drug pipeline and near-term catalysts.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM
  • JBL

    Premarket gainers: JBL +8%. CTIC +7%. YRCW +5%. CHK +5%. AEG +3%. ACN +3%.Losers: AVGO -4%. M -3%.

    Premarket gainers: JBL +8%. CTIC +7%. YRCW +5%. CHK +5%. AEG +3%. ACN +3%.
    Losers: AVGO -4%. M -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • BUD

    Shares of Anheuser-Busch Inbev (NYSE:BUD) tack on 2.3% premarket as mega-merger rumors get...

    Shares of Anheuser-Busch Inbev (NYSE:BUD) tack on 2.3% premarket as mega-merger rumors get played out in the wake of SABMiller (OTCPK:SBMRF) clearing a regulatory hurdle in Australia in its bid to take down Foster's.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:46 AM
  • CHK

    Shares of Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK) soar 6.4% premarket after the firm announces "strong...

    Shares of Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK) soar 6.4% premarket after the firm announces "strong initial production" from wells in Ohio and Pennsylvania, helping boost the company's guidance. The natural gas and oil driller now sees increasing net liquid production 50% by the end 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:21 AM | 1 Comment
  • RL

    Ralph Lauren (NYSE:RL) is down 1.6% premarket after Citi downgrades shares to Hold, and lowers...

    Ralph Lauren (NYSE:RL) is down 1.6% premarket after Citi downgrades shares to Hold, and lowers its PT to $144. While still high on Ralph Lauren's brand and international growth, Citi believes a lot of positive news about market share gains and international penetration is already baked in

     
     
     
     
    | 8:06 AM
  • MNK

    Shares of Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR) gain 5% premarket after the company announces...

    Shares of Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR) gain 5% premarket after the company announces increases in paid prescriptions for its MS treatments, as well as plans to expand its sales efforts.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:58 AM

  • More on Family Dollar Stores (FDO): Comparable store sales +5.6% in Q4, led by...

    More on Family Dollar Stores (FDO): Comparable store sales +5.6% in Q4, led by strong-than-expected foot traffic in stores. Announces plans to open 450-500 new stores in FY12. Authorizes stock buyback plan to purchase an additional $250M of common stock. Shares +2% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:37 AM | 1 Comment
  • MNGPF

    Man Group (OTC:MNGPF) -17% in London after saying AUM fell 8% to $65B despite record fund sales....

    Man Group (OTC:MNGPF) -17% in London after saying AUM fell 8% to $65B despite record fund sales. Redemptions shaved $2.6B; negative performance $1.5B; and a stronger dollar (vs. euro and aussie) drove AUM down $1.9B. The drop underscores how volatile markets are eroding AUM at hedge funds and other asset managers.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 AM
